Class RewardsService

java.lang.Object
com.FeedEmGreens.HealthyAura.service.RewardsService
@Service public class RewardsService extends Object
Service layer responsible for handling all reward- and points-related business logic in the HealthyAura ecosystem.

This class manages the full lifecycle of the user rewards system:

  • Retrieving, adding, and redeeming points
  • Handling reward redemption and validation
  • Automatically creating points records for new users
  • Admin-level point deductions for moderation actions

Access control is enforced via Spring Security. Only the authenticated user can view or modify their own points balance, except in administrative workflows where moderation or system deductions are required.

All database operations are managed through Spring Data JPA repositories, with transactional rollbacks enabled on reward redemptions.

Since:
2025-11-07
Version:
1.0

  • Constructor Details

    • RewardsService

      public RewardsService(PointsRepository pointsRepository, UserRepository userRepository, RewardRepository rewardRepository)
      Constructs a new RewardsService with required dependencies.
      Parameters:
      pointsRepository - repository for managing user points
      userRepository - repository for accessing user entities
      rewardRepository - repository for managing available rewards

  • Method Details

    • getUserPoints

      public Points getUserPoints(String username)
      Retrieves the Points record for a specific user, ensuring that only the authenticated user can access their own points balance.

      If the record does not exist (e.g., a new user), it is automatically created with an initial balance of 0 points.

      Parameters:
      username - the username of the user whose points are being retrieved
      Returns:
      the Points entity associated with the user
      Throws:
      org.springframework.security.access.AccessDeniedException - if an unauthorized user attempts access
      RuntimeException - if the specified user cannot be found

    • addPoints

      public Points addPoints(String username, int pointsToAdd)
      Adds a specified number of points to a user’s account.

      This operation updates the totalPoints field and refreshes the lastUpdated timestamp.

      Parameters:
      username - the username of the user
      pointsToAdd - number of points to add
      Returns:
      the updated Points entity

    • redeemPoints

      public Points redeemPoints(String username, int pointsToRedeem)
      Redeems points for a user, deducting from their total and recording the redeemed amount.

      If the user has insufficient points, an exception is thrown.

      Parameters:
      username - the username of the user
      pointsToRedeem - number of points to redeem
      Returns:
      the updated Points entity
      Throws:
      RuntimeException - if insufficient points are available

    • deductPoints

      public Points deductPoints(String username, int pointsToDeduct)
      Deducts points from a user account.

      This method is primarily used by administrators or background operations (e.g., when a user’s review is deleted). It bypasses the authentication check since moderators are allowed to deduct points from any account.

      Negative balances are permitted according to system policy.

      Parameters:
      username - the username whose points should be deducted
      pointsToDeduct - number of points to remove
      Returns:
      the updated Points entity (may contain negative balance)

    • getAllRewards

      public List<Reward> getAllRewards()
      Retrieves a list of all available Reward objects from the system.
      Returns:
      a list of all rewards (active and inactive)

    • addReward

      public Reward addReward(Reward reward)
      Adds a new reward to the database (for administrative or demo purposes).
      Parameters:
      reward - the reward entity to add
      Returns:
      the saved Reward

    • redeemReward

      @Transactional public RewardResponse redeemReward(String username, Long rewardId)
      Redeems a reward for a user, deducting the required number of points and returning a structured response summarizing the transaction.

      This method is annotated with Transactional to ensure that if any part of the operation fails (e.g., insufficient points), the entire transaction is rolled back and no partial updates occur.

      Parameters:
      username - the username of the user redeeming the reward
      rewardId - the ID of the reward being redeemed
      Returns:
      a RewardResponse object containing redemption details
      Throws:
      RuntimeException - if the reward is not found or insufficient points exist
